results.title: Head start: meeting the computer challenge
results.creator_credit: Diane Beaudry, Kathleen Shannon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Intended for women in the paid work force and young girls about to choose a career, this half-hour film, part drama, part documentary, urges viewers to acquire the skills for careers involving new technologies. In the documentary segments, women who hold senior positions in the field of microtechnology describe changing occupational patterns, and stress the need for training and job-mobility programs. In the dramatic portions, an office worker and her teenaged daughter discover how the technological revolution will affect their careers and decide how to attain their goal of financial independence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Diane Beaudry, Kathleen Shannon and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Head over heels
results.creator_credit: Mark Waters, Robert Simonds and Universal Studios
results.brief_description: Australian supermodel Sarah O’Hare makes her acting debut as one of four models to share a plush Manhatten apartment with our protagonist, Amanda (Monica Potter). Single Amanda is cursed with dating the wrong men and when she spots handsome Jim Winston (Freddie Prinze Jr,) out her window - a man she met under curious circumstances in the lobby - she becomes instantly attracted and decidedly cautious. Under the guidance of her new flatmates, Amanda crashes a party at Jim’s and discovers he is almost too good to be true. Voyeurism wreaks havoc between the two soulmates when Amanda sees what she believes to be Jim committing a murder. When the police fail to locate a body she takes it upon herself to get to the bottom of the matter, ably assisted and hindered by her model friends. Cast also includes Ivana Milicevic, Shalom Harlow, Tomiko Fraser and China Chow.

results.title: Head of the house
results.creator_credit: Richard Leacock, Irving Jacoby and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: A story of community action in mental health, showing how a social worker, a policeman and a minister join forces to help a young boy through the vicissitudes of growing up. This film stresses the relationship between the authoritarian attitudes of a father to his son and the boy’s psychological difficulties.

results.title: Head
results.creator_credit: Bob Rafelson, Jack Nicholson, Columbia and Raybert Productions
results.brief_description: In search for meaning, U.S. sixties band The Monkees roll from one adventure to another in this hilarious plotless movie that manages to sum up the iconography of the day. Through an explosion of images from the sixties, the band bursts through with their silly antics and witty asides on a trajectory to pastiche some of the spirit the pop culture gave birth to in the 20th century. With a cast that includes The Monkees (Peter Tork, David Jones, Mickey Dolenz, Michael Nesmith), Victor Mature, Frank Zappa and Sonny Liston, ‘Head’ manages to turn everything back onto itself.

results.title: He who rests rusts
results.brief_description: An animated film demonstrating the necessity for consistent training and exercise in maintaining physical fitness. The champion cat athlete becomes complacent and therefore loses a challenge race.

results.title: He went to the cupboard
results.creator_credit: Andrew Buchanan and Great Britain. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A study of pantry lay-out, and the necessity for forethought in planning the use of cupboard space. Married life is subjectively represented through domestic ponderance and male ignorance of the kitchen politic.

results.title: He walked by night
results.creator_credit: Alfred L Werker and Robert T Kane
results.brief_description: In the suspenseful tradition of “The Naked City”, and drawn from the documented files of L.A.P.D. Homicide files, “He Walked by Night” is a first class suspense thriller about a desperate burglar who turns into a cop killer and is hounded down by the police. Richard Basehart is brilliant as the fearless fugitive.

results.title: He knows some things
results.brief_description: The use of colour and fluid animation suggests the innocence and carefree nature of childhood while the accompanying voice over suggests that childhood is much more complex. The work demonstrates skilfull use of rotoscoping techniques.
